fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36776].
  {panel}

Current version of Gliffy for Confluence packaged with Cloud Confluence is 6.3.2. Do we have plans to update this to the latest release which is 6.5.1?

The newest version contains quite a few features that would be a great benefit to users of the plugin as well as fixes.

6.5.1 contains the following bug fixes:

Full-screen viewer loading/rendering speed improvements.
"data-pageid" text sometimes appears on Confluence page above Gliffy macro.
IE9 JS error: TypeError: object doesn't support property or method 'pushState'.
Browser page navigation dialog sometimes appears after exiting the Gliffy editor.
Fixes and improvements around diagram version pinning.
Diagram import improvements.
fields.summary: Update the Gliffy plugin to newest version in Cloud

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36775].
  {panel}

When restricting a page in confluence, you can choose *any* user to be able to view the page. But if a certain user is not able to see a superior page due to the restrictions of the superior page, this setting has no effect: he can not see the page although he *seems* to be allowed.

I see 2 possibilities:
a) the user should be able to see the page although he is "blocked" by the superior page
b) when setting restrictions for a page, confluence should only "offer" people, that whould be able to see the page depending on the restrictions of all superior pages

... I would prefer option b!
fields.summary: Show only possible page restrictions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36773].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
Currently, if you have a list of pages, for example:

0xA10A
0xA10B
0xA10C
0xA100
0xA101
0xA102
0xA103

When sorting alphabetically in Move and Reorder Pages, it will sort them as above, and there is no option to configure otherwise, other than doing a Manual Sort.

h4. Suggestion
Provide option to create a custom sort, such as 0123456789ABCDEF... etc. rather than ABCDEF0123456789

Example desired sort order:

0xA100
0xA101
0xA102
0xA103
0xA10A
0xA10B
0xA10C

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36738].
  {panel}

*Background of Request*

Confluence 5.7 introduce a new feature where it is able to preview attachments as can be seen [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+5.7+Release+Notes#Confluence5.7ReleaseNotes-Filesarefirstclasscitizens]. One of the feature available is to covert a thumbnail of attachment into a link with "Show as link" button.

However, once the attachment is converted into a link it is not possible to convert it back to thumbnail. This is because "Show as Thumbnail" button is not available for "Linking" even if it is a link of an attachment.

*Possible Implementation*

Confluence "Linking" feature should be able to differentiate attachment link and URL link. From there, Confluence able to provide "Show as thumbnail" button only for attachment link.
fields.summary: "Show as Thumbnail" Button is not Available for Attachment Link

fields.description:
h4. Summary

Multibyte characters (like Japanese or Chinese) get garbled in preview while they are [Supported languages|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/languages-744721667.html].
h4. Steps to reproduce
 # Upload text file [^memo.txt] which contains Japanese characters to a page in Confluence.
 # Click the document

!Screenshot 2017-06-15 10.14.17.png|thumbnail!
h4. Expected Results

Preview correctly renders Japanese text _"あいうえお"_.
h4. Actual results

Japanese characters get garbled.
h4. Findings

The problem could be solved by the following knowledge base for Confluence Server (but not applicable to Confluence Cloud).
 - [Non-ASCII Characters display as Square Characters in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Non-ASCII+Characters+display+as+Square+Characters+in+Confluence]

The knowledge base article tells the problem could be solved by installing proper font files to both OS and JVM. It seems the OS of Confluence Cloud already has proper font files, however, JVM is not. Users cannot install font files to JVM because the instance is Confluence Cloud.
h4. Workaround
 - Download the file and read it on your local machine

h4. Notes

This issue was originally raised for office macros and rewritten for preview. Office macros are no longer supported as described at [Deprecated macros for Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2015/11/deprecated-macros-for-confluence], however the same unavailablilty persists at preview as well.

 

!confluence-tofus.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Preview doesn't render some of supported languages due to lack of font file

h6. Current Issue:

* Clicking the attachment to view it in the new file viewer renders the attachment in its proper resolution

h6. How to Reproduce:
* Add a high resolution attachment (PDF or image) to a page using the new file insertion feature (Edit page > Insert files and images)
* Save and review the page

h6. Expected Result:

h6. Actual Result

fields.summary: Improve resolution on PDF images using Attachments macro.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36692].
  {panel}

Confluence 5.7 released with a whole new powerful image previewer.  Currently there is no way for you to access the preview tool from the View PDF Macro. You need to have another image embedded onto the site to access the preview option. Then navigate to the PDF this way.

h6. Steps to Reproduce:
- Place a PDF into a page via View PDF Macro.
- There is a option to full screen but never places you in new preview mode.
!PDF macro general Viewer.png|thumbnail!


h6. Current Work Around #1:
- Attach the PDF as an attachment on the site.
- Since it is detected as an attachment the new image previewer will work.
- The Resolution suffers heavily with this macro
!Attachment Macro.png|thumbnail!

h6. Current Work Around #2:
- Place a PDF onto a page.
- Have an image on the same page as the PDF
- Click on the image to load new image preview
- There are arrow toggles to move to the next file.
- Toggle the arrows until PDF is reached.
- The Attached PDF now can be seen via the attachment viewer.
!View PDF Macro With Image.png|thumbnail!
!After Click on Image able to view PDF with new viewer.png|thumbnail!

h6. Desired  Results
- View PDF Macro should allow you to go into new Image preview.
- New Image preview should have a sub set of navigation arrows for PDF page navigation instead of general image navigation.
fields.summary: New Image Previewer does not Auto Render for PDF-Macro.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36691].
  {panel}

Currently, when we have a Gliffy diagram, when we search for it using Confluence search, the link takes us to a page full of text, instead of a view of the diagram.

This is illustrated below:

We can create a diagram in a page and see it in the attachments. The link shown takes us to the diagram:
!link_to_diagram.png|thumbnail!

This is what we see:
!diagram.png|thumbnail!

However, if I search for the diagram:
!search.png|thumbnail!

The link to the attachment is there, as well as to the page and the generated image. However, if I open the attachment, I get:
!text_diagram.png|thumbnail!

Text describing the diagram, instead of the fancy page where I can modify it. 

That is confusing, as the users can't find the diagram page using searches. The '.png' link shows me the diagram, it is the image generated by Gliffy for the diagram. However, I cannot use it to edit the diagram, as it is only an image and it's confusing.

Adding the link to the page where I can edit the diagram (first image) would be much easier and less confusing.
fields.summary: Show different links for Gliffy diagrams in searches

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36670].
  {panel}

At the moment, Space Administrator is able to restrict an anonymous user on the following aspect of Confluence Space:
- Viewing
- Pages (Add/Delete)
- Blogs (Add/Delete)
- Comments (Add/Delete)
- Attachments (Add/Delete)
- Restrictions (Add/Delete)
- Mail (Delete)
- Space (Export/Admin)

Once a 'Viewing' permission is granted to anonymous user, some of the Tools (...) features can still be accessed when viewing a page. It would be a useful to have more control in Confluence Space Administration to increase the instance security and flexibility.

*Workaround*
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/10412410/disable-certain-tool-options-for-anonymous-users
fields.summary: Add More Control In Space Permission to Restrict Anonymous User from Accessing Tools (...) In Page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36669].
  {panel}

The Roadmap Planner Macro bundled into Confluence 5.7 is great, but it could be truly amazing if it were able to pull the data for lanes, bars, and markers from an external source.

At minimum, it would be useful to use a linked JIRA instance as a source for roadmap data, but it would be extremely valuable if this were pluggable in some way so that teams could implement alternative data sources (such as other databases that provide planning information).

Ideally, this capability would allow a single query to provide all the required data (i.e. parsing attributes from the query, mapped to "Lane", "Start Date", "End Date"), but it might also be useful to define separate queries for each lane, allowing for planning data to be amalgamated onto a roadmap.  Markers might always require a separate query as well.

An enhancement like this would provide an amazing visualization capability for planning purposes, rather than requiring someone to manually propagate changes in a planning database to the roadmap diagram.
fields.summary: Enable Roadmap Planner Macro to pull data from an external source

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36663].
  {panel}

The new inline comments in Confluence 5.7 can only be turned off or on system-wide.
This is not sufficient.
I would like the ability to be able to turn inline comments on/off by space.
The reason is that we have different kind of spaces in our Confluence system. For some, the inline comments are great and very welcome (for example in spaces where we develop documentation collaboratively), but for others they are contra-productive. (for example in spaces where the final / released documentation is published)

We don't have the luxury to set up several confluence instance just for being able to manage them differently (like Atlassian does).
Therefore, please provide a space-specific configuration for this feature.
fields.summary: Inline comments should be configurable by space

fields.description:

To Reproduce
# resize the screen at the confluence dashboard to bring up the _More_ option
# resize the navigation bar so more (down arrow) is the only option
# click on more

+Expected+

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36653].
  {panel}

Even though the {{attachments}} table accepts NULL values for {{minor_edit}}, Confluence doesn't expect them and throws a system error in the UI and a stack trace.

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Add an attachment to a page
# Find the corresponding entry for that attachment in the {{attachments}} table, and update the record by setting {{minor_edit}} to NULL
# Flush the Confluence caches
# Navigate to the page with the attachment to see the error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36651].
  {panel}

Usecase: 
We have a Confluence page that many people update many times each day. This is very useful and anyone can go to the page to check the latest. The problem is that it generates a lot of emails if it is watched.

The autowatch feature is great for "normal" pages, but for a "high traffic" page, it isn't very useful. This means that you have to either
1. Not use the autowatch feature, but then you have to remember to manually watch any  "non-high traffic" pages that you create, edit or watch, or
2. Use the autowatch feature, but remember to un-watch high traffic pages every time you edit one.

It would be great if I could define a black list of pages that I never want to be autowatched.
fields.summary: Blacklist of pages that should never be autowatched

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36648].
  {panel}

h1. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup Confluence with URL: http://localhost:10570/confluence/
# Setup JIRA with URL: http://localhost:7315/jira/
# Setup Application Link between Confluence and Jira.
# Update Confluence with URL: http://localhost:8090/confluence/
# Update JIRA with URL: http://localhost:8091/jira/
# Update *Display URL* to http://localhost:8091/jira/ in the Confluence Application Link configuration.
!config.png|thumbnail!
# Create a JIRA Issue macro.
# Observe the links using browser developer tools.

h1. Expected Behaviour
JIRA issue macro should be rendered according to Display URL.

h1. Actual Behaviour
JIRA issue macro icon is rendered based on Application URL.
!tes1.png|thumbnail!
!test2.png|thumbnail!

h6. Note
The icon might not be rendered if *Display URL* is updated with Jira URL link that contains SSL (https) or proxy integration (redirection).
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Macro Icon Does Not Render According to Display URL
Add Inline Comments plugin to Confluence source code bundle

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36645].
  {panel}

The inline comments plugin shipped with Confluence 5.7 appears to have some service interfaces that would be useful to plugins: 
* _com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.inlinecomments.service.InlineCommentService_
* _com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.inlinecomments.service.ReplyCommentService_

But these are not exposed as OSGI public services.

If these classes are intended to form part of a plugin API this issue is to make them public and export the required packages at the OSGI level.  If these interfaces are intended to be internal this issue is about making a proper java api for this bundled plugin.
fields.summary: Inline comments java API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36641].
  {panel}

h3. Use Case
If there are a number of pages with similar titles or a number of attachments (for example images that follow IMG_1234 naming conventions), the search shows a limited number of results (2 in 5.7) but does not allow for wild card searches. 

If I were to want to search for anything that ended with 75, using the standard * for wildcard matches would find 0 results.

Searching the full Confluence instance with wildcard
!site_search.png|thumbnail!

Searching for links without wildcard
!no_wildcard.png|thumbnail!

Searching for links with wildcard in 5.7
!with_wildcard.png|thumbnail!

h3. Improvement
Add wildcard searches to the search box in the Link Macro, similar to the wildcards that are allowed in the regular site search.
fields.summary: Add Wildcards to Search Box for Insert Link Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36627].
  {panel}

Hi,

Detailed reproduction steps:
+Scenario1+
# Use a fresh install of JIRA and Confluence.
# Link applications(use Trusted applications), share user accounts.
# Create two projects.
# Create a wiki page. 
# Open the dialog to create a JIRA issue.
# In this dialog switching between projects should be fast.

+Scenario2+
# Create four more users in JIRA.
# Use German umlauts like "ü" in their full names.
# Reload and edit the wiki page.
# Open the dialog to create a JIRA issue.
# Switching between projects always takes a lot of time.


Regards,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Creating JIRA issues from Confluence takes long time if user full name contains German umlauts

*Workaround*
# Delete any previously failed, half-imported space.
# Shut down Confluence.
# Run the following query in database:
{code}
alter table
CONTENT_PERM
DISABLE constraint
CP_UNIQUE_USER_GROUPS;
{code}
# Start Confluence.
# Import Space.
# Shut down Confluence again.
# Run the following query in database:
{code}
alter table
CONTENT_PERM
ENABLE constraint
CP_UNIQUE_USER_GROUPS;
{code}
(!) *Please backup your database before running the above query.*

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36585].
  {panel}

This is a feature request to provide ability to restrict/allow the following actions in single Confluence pages, that the user have made a comment:

# Restrict Editing of comments that a user has entered. For example, once the comment is done in that page, you need to add a new one in order to not edit it. 
# According to the comment restriction, give the ability to see the edit performed and who have edited the comment.
# Restrict the comment to be edited/removed only be the user that have done it. This would also not allow the confluence-administrators users to make the modifications.
fields.summary: Permission Level for Comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36582].
  {panel}

After creating a page in versions 5.4 or higher, you can create a JIRA Issue in Confluence by highlighting text on the page.  After the issue is created, it is automatically added to the page and there is a normal page update event fired.

This should be distinguishable from normal page edits.  

This is a significant issue for plugins that listen to the PageUpdatedEvent to trigger functionality based on pages actually being updated.

This should also be distinguishable in the page history.
fields.summary: When JIRA issues are automatically added to a page (using highlight text + create JIRA Issue), the event should be distinguished from page update
